div1.head: Letter from Claudia Barret to Henry Rose Carter, 1924
div1.opener:
C1
B20
Halloween, 1924 211 VAIL AVENUE
CHARLOTTE
NORTH CAROLINA
Dear Dr. Carter:-
div1.p:
To-night is Halloween.
I have just come in from
a good time. Mother bought
me the funniest mask
you ever saw.

I started this letter
a few days ago. Today
is monday. Here is a
picture I drew for you.

You ought to see Mary
Russell. She can walk
and say anything she
wants to. She has four
jaw teeth now, that is
one on each jaw. Which
makes 10 teeth altogether.
She is crazy about picking
up acorns. She also likes
to pick up rocks. When
ever we take her out in
the back yard she picks
up acorns all the time.
You ought to see her dance
a jig. She can do that and
*skilpot both.

Lee is coming Tuesday = tommorow
to put up some new swings
in the back yard. And
Ruth Grover, one of my friends
is coming home from school
with me.

I am planning to
have a circus when
I get the new swings.

The men came to take
our radio and fix it.
I don know what was
the matter with.

I recon this is all I have
to say.
div1.closer: Your friend, Claudia Barret *This is the way to skilpot
